name: argc
description: Easily create and use cli based on bash script

repo.name: argc
repo.description: A Bash CLI framework, also a Bash command runner.

readme.summary: Excellent documentation with clear installation, quick start, and examples, but lacks troubleshooting guidance and the README appears truncated.
readme.top_issue: No troubleshooting section for common errors or issues users might encounter

injection_risks.description: The `run_command` function uses user input to construct a command, which can lead to shell injection attacks.
The `run_eval` function uses the `escape_shell_words` function to escape user input, but it does not prevent all possible shell injection attacks.

critical_findings: Potential for shell injection attacks due to insufficient input validation and sanitization
security.summary: The argc package has some security concerns related to input validation and potential shell injection attacks, but overall it appears to be a well-structured and secure codebase.

common_complaints: Parser incorrectly interprets argc tags inside heredoc template strings
Lack of modular script support for splitting large argc scripts across files
Shellcheck SC2154 warnings with argc-defined variables
Limited inline usage options and flexibility
praise_themes: Good feature set for command-line script development
sentiment.summary: Argc has healthy community engagement with active maintainers addressing feature requests and bug reports, though users seek improvements in modular script organization, parser edge cases, and development tooling integration.

communication.summary: The maintainer's responses are clear, helpful, and patient. They provide technical depth while maintaining a welcoming tone.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being from August 2025
No active contributors in past 6 months
Open issues present with no recent resolution activity
No merged PRs in past 6 months indicating no active development
Unknown last release date suggests release tracking may be incomplete or abandoned
positive_signals: Project has received commits historically (last commit exists)
Only 2 open issues suggests manageable scope if resumed
maintenance.summary: The argc package appears stale with no maintenance activity or contributor engagement over the past 6 months, though it has not been completely abandoned.

project_metrics.description: A Bash CLI framework, also a Bash command runner.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is clear and provides a good introduction to the package, but lacks troubleshooting information.
concerns: Only one contributor active in the past six months
Docs: Lack of troubleshooting section or common problems and solutions documentation
Community: lack of global Argcfile support
Security: Potential for shell injection attacks due to insufficient input validation and sanitization
Security: The `run_command` function uses user input to construct a command, which can lead to shell injection attacks.
High bus factor risk (99% from top contributor)
highlights: Recent commits and releases within the last six months
Two merged PRs in the past six months
